caption:
This photograph captures a construction or industrial scene set alongside a body of water, possibly a river or lake. The image prominently features several elements related to construction work.

In the foreground, there is a large concrete-like structure that appears partially covered with a white tarp. On top of this structure, various items are scattered, including what looks like rods or poles, possibly for reinforcement purposes. Next to this structure is a dark item that seems to be a coil of ropes or wires. A makeshift plywood ramp leans against the concrete structure, suggesting it's used to move items or allow access to different levels of the site.

To the right, a focal point of the scene is a cement mixer, loaded with a mixture, indicating an ongoing or paused mixing operation. There are also buckets, a wheelbarrow, and various smaller tools, likely used for construction purposes, placed around the mixer.

There are two individuals present in the scene, both dressed casually, one wearing a white t-shirt and the other in a darker colored top, with protective hard hats. They are engaged in what looks like a discussion or planning, standing apart and facing each other, indicative of coordination or supervision activities.

The natural environment surrounding the construction site appears serene, with a calm body of water and trees leaning over the water’s edge, which contrasts with the industrial activity. The sandy ground and the gentle slope leading to the water suggest a riverbank or lakeside location.

Overall, the photograph conveys a busy yet organized construction site setup in a picturesque natural setting, highlighting human activity’s interaction with nature.
title: Water control facilities are being constructed at Nashua jointly assisted by the EPA Water Quality Office and the New Hampshire Water Supply and Pollution Control Commission.
